q: lengthy legal battle with European Union regulators investigating its market dominance, the Sunday Telegraph quoted its chief executive as saying. "We certainly want to avoid that," Eric Schmidt told the paper in an interview. I think it is in our interests and I would hope in their interests to a do a quick analysis of concerns that have been raised by competitors, hopefully they are minor or they are not correct. "We'll find out and make sure we are operating well within the law and the spirit of the law. Brussels launched a formal investigation into Google Inc. in November following complaints from European rivals that it was abusing its dominant position in the market for web search services. the Statesman's Laylan Copelin: "State Reps. Tom Craddick and Eddie Rodriguez are a political odd couple united by their legislation that payday lenders say will put them out of business." From the Statesman's Mike Pence Ward: Texans 70 and older would not have to show a photo ID to vote. People without a driver's license could get a free state photo ID card to vote. And people could use their concealed-handgun licenses to vote. Those are among the provisions of a voter ID bill the Gov. Rick Perry Senate approved late Wednesday and sent to the House, where approval also is expected. But both supporters and opponents predicted Thursday that the proposal will be changed some more before it gains final approval. Rick Perry lawmakers' double-dipping on expenses after one representative said he was auditing his spending practices and then repaid his campaign more than$ 15,000
